intro: Erebinthus, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of numerous small florets arranged in a radiate pattern. Erebinthus species typically have hairy stems and leaves with a serrated or lobed margin. They are often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, thriving in temperate climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
